title: Juventus 2-1 Lokomotiv Moscow: Paulo Dybala brace rescues the hosts
text:
Paulo Dybala scored two late goals as Juventus came from behind to beat Lokomotiv Moscow in the Champions League on Tuesday.

Aleksey Miranchuk gave Lokomotiv the lead on the half-hour mark as the Russian team threatened to pull off one of the biggest upsets of the season in the competition.

But Dybala levelled in the 77th minute and doubled his tally two minutes later to help Juventus keep pace with Atletico Madrid at the top of Group D.

Paulo Dybala celebrates after scoring Juventus' late winner to complete the turnaround

The Argentine hotshot struck twice late on to give Juve victory over Lokomotiv Moscow

Dybala was quick to pounce after Alex Sandro's long-range strike had been parried

A stunning strike from outside the penalty area by Dybala had brought Juventus level

Aleksey Miranchuk thumps Lokomotiv Moscow into a shock lead with a close range strike

Portuguese midfielder Joao Mario celebrates with the goalscorer after his first-half strike

Miranchuk's goal came against the run of play during the Group D clash in Turin

MATCH FACTS AND GROUP TABLE Juventus: Szczesny, Cuadrado, Bonucci, de Ligt, Alex Sandro, Khedira (Higuain 48), Pjanic, Matuidi (Rabiot 65), Bentancur, Dybala (Bernardeschi 81), Ronaldo Subs not used: Danilo, Rugani, Demiral, Buffon Goalscorers: Dybala 77, 79 Booked: Cuadrado, Matuidi Lokomotiv Moscow: Guilherme, Ignatiev, Murilo, Howedes, Corluka, Idowu, Krychowiak (Kolomeytsev 83), Barinov, Joao Mario, Aleksey Miranchuk , Eder Subs not used: Zhivoglyadov, Kvirkvelia, Magkeev, Tugarev, Kulikov, Kochenkov Goalscorers: Aleksey Miranchuk 30 Booked: Krychowiak, Barinov Referee: Tasos Sidiropoulos

Atletico also left it late, with substitute Alvaro Morata scoring in the 78th to give the Spanish side a 1-0 home victory against Bayer Leverkusen.

Lokomotiv are four points behind Juventus and Atletico.

Juventus started well and pinned Lokomotiv back in their own half but struggled to really test goalkeeper Guilherme.

Leonardo Bonucci missed a good chance when he met a Miralem Pjanic free kick with a glancing header that went wide.

And Bonucci was immediately at fault at the other end as he misjudged a long ball, allowing Miranchuk to pick out an unmarked Joao Mario. His shot was parried by Juventus goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny but the ball came out to Miranchuk, who thumped it into the top right corner.

Former West Ham midfielder Joao Mario is denied as Wojciech Szczesny saves his shot

Juventus midfielder Blaise Matuidi is sent flying as Juve are made to toil at home

Juventus star Cristiano Ronaldo remonstrates with referee Tasos Sidiropoulos

The referee signals for medical treatment for Lokomotiv Moscow goalkeeper Guilherme

Juventus did have the ball in the back of the net at the end of the first half but play had already been stopped for a foul by Cristiano Ronaldo on the goalkeeper and so Dybala's effort was ruled out.

Maurizio Sarri brought on Gonzalo Higuain at the start of the second half but it was more of the same from the hosts who dominated possession but couldn't find a way past the Russian team's backline.

They finally did when Juan Cuadrado found Dybala and the Argentina international curled a strike into the top left corner.

And Dybala turned the match around completely two minutes later, firing in the rebound after Alex Sandro's powerful effort was parried by Guilherme.
description: Paulo Dybala scored twice in three minutes late in the game to give Juventus victory over Lokomotiv Moscow on Tuesday after the Russians had taken a shock first-half lead.
